page.title: 06BORDON SHOPPING FACILITIES.
page.content: Shopping facilities in Bordon have increased since the Forest Centre was opened in 1983.Until then the main shopping area was Chalet Hill and the A325. Now the Forest Centre is more popular. As the village grew there was a demand for better shopping facilities and so the Forest Centre was built. Also the new housing areas were being built away from the old shopping area so a more centralised shopping area was needed. The centre provides customers with free parking, public toilets and shops all under one roof. The old Chalet Hill shops have changed during the years. The oldest shop, Frisby's, is well known for its turquoise coloured dome. Parking there is difficult because of the busy road junction.
